Paragraph: The superoxide scavenger tempol ( 30 , 100 , and 300 micromol kg ( - 1 ) , IV ) did not change arterial pressure in control rats but caused a dose - dependent decrease in LNNA rats ( - 18 + / - 8 , - 26 + / - 15 , and - 54 + / - 11 mm Hg ) .

Explanation:

In the given paragraph, the only disease entity mentioned is "LNNA rats." The LNNA (Nω-Nitro-L-arginine) is a drug that is used to induce hypertension in experimental animals, and in this case, it is being used as a disease model for studying the effects of the superoxide scavenger tempol on arterial pressure.
